intro: Randia calycosa, commonly known as the Florida hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The flowers are usually pink to red in color and bloom in the summer months. Randia calycosa is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. It thrives in wetlands and is often found in swampy areas, where it plays a role in the local ecosystem.
